summary: Drug Abuse Warning Network (DAWN) National Estimates from Drug-Related Emergency Department Visits, 2023 [OCR Supplement] This report was prepared for the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA), U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)

Injuries – both physical and mental – from violence and crime contribute greatly to the overall burden of disease and death. Violent crimes disproportionately affect communities of color and young adults. Post-traumatic stress in victims, families, and community members add significantly to mental health problems and are risk factors for chronic illnesses like cardiovascular disease.
